title: The DAPI cms API call will contain the data published and last time the article was updated
custom_preconds: Given I make an API call to https://dapi.cms.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/stories/archie-bradley-greg-holland-d-backs-closer
custom_steps: When I look into the response body
custom_expected:
Then I should see contentDate as the date the article was published
And I should see lastUpdatedDate as the last time the article was updated

title: The DAPI API call will contain the article header as `headline`
The DAPI API call may or may not contain the article sub-header as `fileds.subHeadline`
The DAPI API call may or may not contain information about the date the article was published in 'contentDate' field
The DAPI API call may contain player and/or team tag information.
On a mobile device, the related articles will display within the article
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article in a mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll down in the article
custom_expected: THEN I should see Related article content within the article I'm viewing

title: There will be at least 1 related article for a given article
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article in a mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll down in the article
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Related article content within the article I'm viewing
AND I should see at least 1 article in the Related section

title: On a large viewport, i.e. regualr computer browsers, the related articles will be displayed on the right side of the viewing article
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article in a computer
custom_expected: THEN I should see Related articles on the right side of the page

title: There will be some `Recommended` article for a viewing article
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article in a computer
AND I am in the correct user group 
-- note: the system will automatically add you to a group. if you don't see it in 1 browser, try a different browser
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the Recommended section
AND the title will be "You may have missed ..."

title: When an article contains an external link, it will be highlighted in Blue
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
AND the article contains some external links
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll down to a link within the article
custom_expected:
THEN I should see them highlighted in blue
AND the page will open the external link when clicked on it

title: When an article contains an external link, it will open in a new tab when clicked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
AND the article contains some external links
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll down to a link within the article
custom_expected:
THEN I should see them highlighted in blue
AND the page will open the external link when clicked on it

title: At the end of an article, there will be tags of teams and players who were mentioned in the article
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/pedro-severino-orioles-deal
custom_steps: When I scroll to the end of the article
custom_expected:
Then I should see the tag section titled "In this story:"
And I should see the tags

title: The listed tags will be clickable and open the attached URL in the same window
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing article [https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/pedro-severino-orioles-deal]
custom_steps:
When I scroll to the end of the article of the tag section
And I click on a tag
custom_expected: Then I should see the targeted url open in the same page

title: An article can omit the tag line containing the author information
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing an article at this url: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/prospects-who-could-be-traded
custom_steps: When I scroll to the bottom of the article content
custom_expected: Then I should not see any author tag line section

title: When an article is being viewed in the app, the header & footer will be suppressed
For a paid customer, there will be no ads displayed on the xNews articles
Each news article will have ads associated with it
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article in a mobile device
AND the article contains some videos
custom_steps: WHEN I a watching a video from the article
custom_expected: THEN I should see ads while watching videos

title: Each video in an article will be playable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article in a mobile device
AND the article contains some videos
custom_expected: THEN I should be able to play each video

title: Each article will contain a clap icon to receive the reader's feedback
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps: WHEN I read an article
custom_expected: THEN I should see a clap icon at the end of the article

title: When a user likes an article, the system will suggest more articles which are like it
When an article is viewed as a webview from within an app, the route will be:  https://www.mlb.com/app/atbat/news/slug
An article will have a header
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing article with URL: ""
custom_expected: Then I should see a header for the article

title: An article can be presented without a header and a sub-header
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing the following article <URL>
custom_expected:
Then I should not see a header for the article
And I should not see a sub-header for the article

title: An article should have og:url meta variable value.
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/pedro-severino-orioles-deal
custom_steps:
When I inspect to view the html page source 
And I search for "og:url" in the html search box
custom_expected: Then I should see the property = "og:url" variable

title: Each related article will contain the article header and the published date
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps: WHEN I am looking at the Related articles section
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the related articles headers
AND I should see the published date associated with the articles

title: Author's name should display in font size of 16x
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article with an author
custom_steps: WHEN I check the font size of the contributor(s) name(s)
custom_expected: THEN I should see the font size as 16

title: An article may not contain contributor details
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article with no author
custom_expected: THEN I should not see any contributor details

title: A story must contain a share icon and a share link
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps: WHEN I look in the header section of the article
custom_expected: THEN I should see a share link and a share link icon

title: There will be a dark/light theme to read xNews articles
custom_preconds:
Given I am using my device (hand-held or Win/Mac OS)
And my OS is in set to dark theme
custom_steps: When I visit a news article using the URL: <article URL>
custom_expected: Then I should see the article loaded in dark theme

title: Author headshot will be 45x45 in size
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article with a contributor listed
custom_steps: WHEN I inspect the contributor's image size
custom_expected: THEN I should see the image size as 45x45

title: An article should have og:type meta variable and content value.
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect to view the html page source 
AND I search for "og:type" in the html search box
custom_expected: THEN I should see the property = "og:type" variable

title: An article should have twitter:card meta variable and content value.
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect to view the html page source 
AND I search for "twitter:card" in the html search box
custom_expected: THEN I should see the name = "twitter:card" variable

title: An article will have a sub-header
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
-- i.e https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/mets/news/starling-marte-leaves-game-after-beaning?t=all-mlb-team-coverage
custom_expected: Then I should see a sub-header for the article

title: An article should have twitter:site meta variable and content value.
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect to view the html page source 
AND I search for "twitter:site" in the html search box
custom_expected: THEN I should see the name = "twitter:site" variable

title: An article may contain gif
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
-- https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/marcus-stroman-throws-another-six-scoreless-innings-for-cubs
AND the article contains a gif
custom_expected: Then I should see a gif playing

title: An article may have multiple contributors/authors and when there are more than 3 authors, there should be a line break for the authors
custom_preconds:
Given I am viewing an article with at least 1 contributor


-- i.e. https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/news/dj-lemahieu-yankees-reunion-likelihood
custom_expected: Then I should see 4 contributors

title: An author will has his/her twitter tag associated to his/her name
custom_preconds:
Given I am viewing an article with at least 1 contributor

-- https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/dj-lemahieu-yankees-reunion-likelihood
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the contributor's twitter tag displayed
AND I should be able to click on the twitter tag which will open the contributor's twitter page

title: An article may have multiple authors and all author headshots will be displayed on top of the article
custom_preconds:
Given I am viewing an article with multiple contributors

https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/dj-lemahieu-yankees-reunion-likelihood
custom_expected:
Then I should see multiple authors
And I should see a head-shot for each author

title: There will be at most 6 related articles for a given article
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article on a desktop

-- https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/dj-lemahieu-yankees-reunion-likelihood
custom_steps: WHEN I look on the right side panel of the page
custom_expected: THEN I should see the first Related section with 6 articles

title: An article may contain a tag line containing 1 or more authors information
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps: When I scroll to the bottom of the article
custom_expected: Then I should see the tag section

title: A story with tam and/or player tags will have a "In this story" section at the bottom of the article
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
AND the article is tagged with some team(s) and/or player(s)
custom_steps: WHEN I scroll towards the bottom of the article
custom_expected: THEN I should see the article contain some tags for team(s) and/or player(s)

title: A story with "x" number of player and/or team tags will display all "x" tags at the bottom of the story
custom_preconds:
Given I have a dapi url: "https://dapi.cms.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/stories/oldest-mlb-players-having-great-seasons"
And I have  "https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/mets/stories/oldest-mlb-players-having-great-seasons"
custom_steps:
When I view the API response
And I collect the tag values whose ExternalSourceName is team or player
And I view the article with the article URL in a browser
custom_expected: Then I should see all the collected tag values at the bottom of the page in "In this story" section

title: A story containing contributor details will display the contributor details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an article
AND the article contains contributor details
custom_expected: THEN I should see contributor details with name, twitter tag etc.

title: In a web browser, a story can be shared via facebook in social media and be mailed to a person & the link can be copied for other purposes(except for safari in Mac & Edge in Win10)
custom_preconds: Open Chrome or FF
custom_steps:
Go to https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/es/stories/victor-y-julio-hicieron-historia-por-mexico?t=2020-world-series-coverage
Click on the Share link or the Share icon next to the text
Click on Facebook icon
Login with your credentials
custom_expected:
You should be able the share the article

# note # very similar case for Twitter

title: The first video in an article will play automatically
custom_preconds:
Given I am viewing an article 
And the first viewing content of the article is a video
custom_expected:
Then the video should be playing automatically (ads may load first)
But the subsequent videos will not auto-play
And the subsequent videos can be played by using the pressing on Play icon

title: An article in Windows/MacOS will display ads on the side
custom_preconds: Given I am viewing an article in Windows/MacOS
custom_expected:
Then I should see some ads on the right hand side
And I should see an ad on top of the article

title: An article in a hand-held device will load ads within the article
custom_preconds:
Given I am reading an article in a hand-held device
-- https://x-fede-shadow-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/marcus-stroman-throws-another-six-scoreless-innings-for-cubs
custom_expected: Then I should see some ads within the article content.

title: In a web browser, a story can be shared via native shareable links
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing an article
custom_steps: WHEN I click on the share icon
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the native share icons open up
AND I should be able to share the article via each available option

title: Byline value in forge will appear in UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a story in forge: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/12b9170e-64a4-4221-b602-20ea6523d062
AND I have a value for Byline "Siddiq"
AND I have a contributor tag with "contributor/Adam Berry"
custom_steps: WHEN I navigate to beta page: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/es/news/test-copy-of-pete-alonso-a-la-lista-de-lesionados-test
custom_expected:
THEN I should see "Siddiq" in the author name location 
AND I should see Adam Berry's headshot
AND I should see Adam Berry's twitter handle

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see "data.byline" value to be "Siddiq"

title: Tagline value in forge will display in UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a story in forge: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/12b9170e-64a4-4221-b602-20ea6523d062
AND I have a value for Tagline "Which player will hit the longest home run in the T-Mobile Home Run Derby, as measured by Statcast?"
custom_steps: WHEN I navigate to beta page: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/es/news/test-copy-of-pete-alonso-a-la-lista-de-lesionados-test
custom_expected:
THEN I should see "Which player will hit the longest home run in the T-Mobile Home Run Derby, as measured by Statcast?" in the tagline at the end of an article
AND I should not see the following: 
[Adam Berry](mailto:adam.berry@mlb.com)  covers the Rays for MLB.com and covered the Pirates from 2015-21. Follow him on Twitter [@adamdberry](http://twitter.com/adamdberry/)."
which is fields.tagline value in the following call: `https://beta-dapi.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/es-us/contributors/adam-berry`

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the "data.tagline" value to be "Which player will hit the longest home run in the T-Mobile Home Run Derby, as measured by Statcast?"

title: In the absence of a byline, the contributor's details will be displayed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a story in forge: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/b0a5cac5-f3b2-48b5-b2f3-a1c021815c99
AND I have now value for Byline property
AND I have a contributor tag with "contributor/Adam Berry"
custom_steps: WHEN I navigate to beta page: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/news/pete-alonso-leaves-game-with-injury-test
custom_expected:
THEN I should see "Adam Berry" in the author/contributor name location
AND I should see Adam Berry's headshot
AND I should see Adam Berry's twitter handle

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see data.story.byline value to be empty, ""

title: In the absence of a tagline, the contributor's tagline details will be displayed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a story in forge: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/b0a5cac5-f3b2-48b5-b2f3-a1c021815c99
AND I have now value for Tagline property
AND I have a contributor tag with "contributor/Adam Berry"
custom_steps: WHEN I navigate to beta page: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/news/pete-alonso-leaves-game-with-injury-test
custom_expected:
THEN I should see the following:
'Adam Berry covers the Rays for MLB.com and covered the Pirates from 2015-21. Follow him on Twitter @adamdberry."'
which is fields.tagline value in the following call: https://beta-dapi.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/es-us/contributors/adam-berry

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the data.story.tagline value to be empty, ""

title: URL redirect
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/news/gamepreview-748548
custom_expected: THEN I should be redirected to https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/game-preview/748548

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be redirected to https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/es/stories/game-preview/717421
THEN I should be redirected to https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/stories/2023-world-series-mvp-odds

title: A news article can have embedded story
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am in forge
custom_steps: WHEN I go to https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/news/copy-of-test-oembed-story-aug-7
custom_expected: THEN I should see some embeds in the story

title: Attempt to add wrong oEmbed content URL
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on forge page 
AND I am editing a story: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/69a51f2e-fa54-472a-b26c-9b91f29a6453
custom_steps: WHEN I attempt to add a wrong URL in the oEmbed section
custom_expected: THEN I should see an error message

title: Adding oEmbed content from FB or Twitter
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on forge page
AND I am editing a story: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/69a51f2e-fa54-472a-b26c-9b91f29a6453
custom_steps: WHEN I attempt to add a correct URL: https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=743363977666164&set=a.388412939827938 in the oEmbed section
custom_expected: THEN I should see the content loading successfully

title: Press release articles will use data-graph
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing a "/press-release/*" article FROM PRESS RELEASE BETA ARTICLES [Examples]
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect the page
AND I filter the Network tab with "data-graph" value
custom_expected: THEN I should see at least 1 data-graph request made

title: News articles will use data-graph
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing a "/news/" article FROM NEWS ARTICLES IN BETA [Examples]
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect the page
AND I filter the Network tab with "data-graph" value
custom_expected: THEN I should see at least 1 data-graph request made

title: World baseball classic articles will use data-graph service
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am viewing a "/world-baseball-classic/" article WORLD BASEBALL CLASSIC BETA ARTICLES [Examples]
custom_steps:
WHEN I inspect the page
AND I filter the Network tab with "data-graph" value
custom_expected: THEN I should see at least 1 data-graph request made

title: news articles will support HTML tables
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have an existing Forge article: https://forge.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/stories/f7c32f7b-a0da-44bf-bb69-17a31a1c390e
AND I have the graphQL query to run
AND I have the variables to go with it
custom_steps: WHEN I make a request to graphQL server
custom_expected:
THEN I should get a valid response
AND I should see `htmlContent` 
AND I should see the table row count field
AND I should see the __typename as "Html"

title: /news/partnerId will produce 404 NOT Internal server error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a base_url: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/ || https://mlb.com/
GIVEN I am on 
base_url + news%3FpartnerId%3Dzh-20231207-1111580-mlb-1-A%26qid%3D1026%26%5B%E2%80%A6%5DEHWFaQffJw2t9XTHmrYRB02vDtS57IKww5QiC3G%26bt_ts%3D1701955920956 
page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a 404 page
![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997348)
AND I should NOT see ![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997349)

title: /world-baseball/newsletter will produce 404 NOT Inter Server Error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a base_url: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/ || https://mlb.com/
GIVEN I am on
base_url + world-baseball-classic/newsletter
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a 404 page
![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997350)
AND I should NOT see ![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997351)

title: /news/articles/ will produce 404 NOT Inter Server Error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a base_url: https://beta-gcp.mlb.com/ || https://mlb.com/
GIVEN I am on
news/article/78537402/giants-pick-high-school-pitcher-logan-webb-in-fourth-round
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a 404 page
![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997350)
AND I should NOT see ![](index.php?/attachments/get/13997351)

title: all vidoes should autoplay
auto play should play ads for non-logged in users
autoplay should play ads for unpaid logged in users
[en]When a news article is loaded, tabbing throgh the page will bring the user to Skip To Content button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an English article "/news/joey-votto-retires-from-baseball"
AND I wait for the page to be fully loaded
AND I do not interact with any part of the page
custom_steps: WHEN I hit TAB from my keyboard
custom_expected: THEN I should see focus on the "Skip To Content" button

title: [en]Pressing or hitting ENTER from keyboard will move focus from the button to the header of the article
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an English article "/news/joey-votto-retires-from-baseball"
AND I wait for the page to be fully loaded
AND I do not interact with any part of the page
custom_steps:
WHEN I hit TAB from my keyboard
AND I press ENTER key from the keyboard
custom_expected: THEN I should see focus moving the headline of the article

title: [en]In safari, the page will NOT display the button without a11y feature [Voice Over] enabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an English article "/news/joey-votto-retires-from-baseball" on Safari browser
AND I wait for the page to be fully loaded
AND I do not interact with any part of the page
AND I have Voice Over [a11y] enabled
custom_steps: WHEN I hit TAB from my keyboard
custom_expected: THEN I should see focus on the "Skip To Content" button

custom_steps_separated.content: AND I press ENTER key from the keyboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see focus moving the headline of the article

AND I do not interact with any part of the page
custom_steps: WHEN I hit TAB from my keyboard
custom_expected: THEN I should see focus on the "Saltar al Contenido" button

custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an English article "/es/news/juan-soto-y-aaron-judge-dan-jonron-en-el-mismo-juego-por-undecima-vez"
AND I wait for the page to be fully loaded
AND I do not interact with any part of the page
custom_steps:
WHEN I hit TAB from my keyboard
AND I press ENTER key from the keyboard
custom_expected: THEN I should see focus moving the headline of the article

title: [es]In safari, the page will NOT display the button without a11y feature [Voice Over] enabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am viewing an English article "/es/news/juan-soto-y-aaron-judge-dan-jonron-en-el-mismo-juego-por-undecima-vez" on Safari browser
AND I wait for the page to be fully loaded
AND I do not interact with any part of the page

title: An article will support a simple HTML table
HTML table should wrap with more columns which go beyond viewport
